conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine the initial distance between two cars.
Car A starts at 25 m/s and stops at 25 seconds; Car B starts at 15 m/s and stops at 20 seconds.
Calculate deceleration for Car A as -1 m/s².
Calculate deceleration for Car B as -0.75 m/s².
Determine distance traveled by Car A as 312.5 m using the area under the graph.
Determine distance traveled by Car B as 150 m using the area under the graph.
Calculate initial distance between the cars as 162.5 m.
Conclude that if they collided, the initial distance was less than 162.5 m.
Final answer: initial distance was 162.5 meters, less if they collided.
